SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
MEDIA CLOUD
Add TV Placements to Your Media Plan

Use the TV tab to add TV placements to your media plan.

With Spring '24, customers can plan their TV ad placements based on Gross Rating Points, Impressions, or both, with an option to select deals based on Spots or Ad Time, directly from the media planning grid.

NOTE The enhanced grid is available only for TV placements with the deal type set to Channel Led and the sell type set to Spot. For all other deal types and sell types, use the existing planning grid.

Advertising Sales Management supports rate cards, which are created for a specific channel, demography, region, customer, and so on. Out-of-the-box, Advertising Sales Management provides grouped rate cards according to channels and demographic codes. For more information on creating a rate card by using Grouped Decision Matrices, see Create and Configure a Grouped Decision Matrix.

The enhanced TV planning grid contains these elements:

Rating. Define rating, impressions, and pricing data in rate cards.

Demographic codes. Select the primary and secondary audience demographic codes for your placements.

Sell Type. Choose to sell spots or ad time.

Spot Calendar. Toggle between the standard calendar grid or the spot calendar grid, as required.

KPI Summary. Use KPI Summary to view the media plan summary.

Full Screen View. View the Add & Configure Media Placements grid in full screen.

Impression-based or rating-based deals. Create deals based on impressions, ratings, or a combination of both.

Your TV ad placements can have the following data:

COLUMN NAME	DESCRIPTION
% GRP	The percentage split of impressions per line as compared to all the lines in a given media plan.
Base Rate	The rate of the ad placement per spot. This value is set in the product catalog.
Broadcast Days	The days of the week during which the advertisement is broadcast.
CPM	The cost per 1,000 impressions. This is a measure of cost efficiency, which enables you to compare the cost of this advertisement with that of other advertisements. CPM is calculated as the media cost divided by the number of impressions, and this number is further divided by 1,000.
CPP	The Cost Per Point (CPP) is a measure of cost efficiency, which enables you to compare the cost of this advertisement to that of other advertisements. CPP is calculated as the media cost divided by the Gross Rating Point (GRP).
Day Part	The day part specifies the time frame of the day in which advertisements are run.
GRP	The Gross Rating Point (GRP) measures the impact of the advertisement.
Hiatus Days	The days in the week when the advertisement hiatus is in place. On these days of the hiatus period, the advertisement will not be broadcast.
Pricing Length	The pricing model for the advertisement placement; whether a flat fee or per spot.
Prim Imps	The impressions associated with the Primary demographic code selected by the user.
Ratings	The percentage of the media market that is likely exposed to your advertisement. Rating is an estimate based on the past performance, often sourced from surveys.
Sec Imps	The impressions associated with the secondary demographic code selected by the user.
Spot Length	The length of the advertisement spot.
Spots	A single broadcast of the advertisement.
Total Imps	Impressions are the total number of exposures to your advertisement. One person may be exposed to an advertisement multiple times. Impressions are calculated by multiplying the number of spots by average persons.
Add TV Ad Placements to Your Media Plan

Use the TV tab in the Create Media Plan workflow in Advertising Sales Management to add TV ad placements to your media plan.

Click TV.

You can create your TV placements in two ways: channel-led or program-led.

Use the Deal Type toggle to create Channel Led or Program/Package Led deal types.
Use the edit icon in the cells to enter the required information and configure the placements.

In the Add & Configure Placements screen of the Create Media Plan workflow, choose a value for the Pricing Modal and enter the number of Requested Units. You can also use the One Time Charge column to specify by what amount or percentage the price of the product is to be reduced or increased.

Click Add Placement to add and configure a new placement.
To add placements in a new channel, click Add Channel.
Click View Insights to view analytical insights into your media plan.
(Optional) To apply a discount on the media plan, click Apply Discount. Select the checkbox for the type of discount you want to apply, and from the Percentage drop down list, select the discount percentage. Then click Apply.
On the View Summary page, review the media plan and make any final adjustments.
When the plan is ready, click Submit for Approval.

The quote is created and sent for approval. The quote status is marked as "In Review". Once approved, you're ready to create the insertion order.

Add TV Placements to Your Media Plan From the Enhanced Media Grid

In the Spring '24 release and later, the TV media planning grid has been enhanced to allow you to plan your TV as placements based on GRPs, Impressions, or both, with an option to select deals based on Spots or Ad Time.

NOTE The enhanced grid is available only for TV placements with the Deal Type set to Channel-led and the Sell Type set to Spot.
In your configure media placements screen, click TV.
Set the Deal Type to Channel-led and the Sell Type to Spot.
Use the edit icon in the cells to select the channel and ad space specification. Enter the required information, and configure the placements.
Click the edit icon associated with Demo Code to select the Primary demographic code for your placement.
Click Add Placement to add and configure a placement.
Click New Channel to add placements in a new channel.
Click KPI Summary to view the summary of your media plan.
